description.raw:
Builds on top of pull request #114

Also requires ign-sensors [pull request #27](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-sensors/pull-requests/27/componentize-plugins/diff) \(update: merged\), and ign-cmake `gz11` branch

ign-gui [pull request #184](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-gui/pull-requests/184/migrate-imagedisplay-to-qml/diff) \(update: merged\) is optional but helps to see the camera sensor data visualized in the gui.

A scene manager class is added to populate the scene based on components received through the Entity Component Manager. The functionality currently duplicates the one in ign-gui Scene3d plugin. We’ll need to come up with a plan to merge the two together.

Here’s the camera sensor data visualized in ign-gui:

![](data/bitbucket.org/repo/8zodKzn/images/3726824267-ign_sensor_data.png)
‌

The brightness in the ign-gui 3D render window \(left\) looks way off :confused: I had thought it was due to the switch to PBR in ogre2 but now I’ll have to revisit this issue and study how ogre2 does gamma correction in order to do the same for the 3D render window.
description.html:
Builds on top of pull request #114

Also requires ign-sensors pull request #27 (update: merged), and ign-cmake gz11 branch

ign-gui pull request #184 (update: merged) is optional but helps to see the camera sensor data visualized in the gui.

A scene manager class is added to populate the scene based on components received through the Entity Component Manager. The functionality currently duplicates the one in ign-gui Scene3d plugin. We’ll need to come up with a plan to merge the two together.

Here’s the camera sensor data visualized in ign-gui:

‌

The brightness in the ign-gui 3D render window (left) looks way off I had thought it was due to the switch to PBR in ogre2 but now I’ll have to revisit this issue and study how ogre2 does gamma correction in order to do the same for the 3D render window.
